text: Groton School is a preparatory boarding school in Massachusetts. It was started in 1884 by the Rev. Endicott Peabody. It gives free education to students with household incomes below $75,000 a year. It has a chapel, St. John's Chapel. It has 270 students. Boarders pay $53,870 a year. ==References== Category:Schools in Massachusetts Category:1884 establishments in the United States Category:19th-century establishments in Massachusetts
title: Groton School
